noun.description: A brief record of facts, topics, or thoughts, written down as an aid to memory.
examples: I'll make a note in my diary
Robyn arranged her notes on the lectern

noun.description: A short informal letter or written message.
examples: I left her a note explaining where I was going

noun.description: A single tone of definite pitch made by a musical instrument or the human voice.
examples: the last notes of the symphony died away

noun.description: A particular quality or tone that reflects or expresses a mood or attitude.
examples: there was a note of scorn in her voice
the decade could have ended on an optimistic note

verb.description: Notice or pay particular attention to (something)
examples: please note that you will not receive a reminder that final payment is due
he noted down her address on a piece of paper

phrases: many of his comments are worthy of note
It took a while for the game to burst into life and there had been little of note prior to Chorley breaking the deadlock seven minutes before the break.
We've heard from several readers today, with comments particularly worthy of note.
It was a point worthy of note but in the grand scheme of things it was nothing more and their victory is something Spartans can be truly proud of.
There is one e-mail, however, that may be more worthy of note than the others.
origin: Middle English (in note (sense 4 of the noun) and note (sense 1 of the verb)): from Old French note (noun), noter (verb), from Latin nota a mark, notare to mark.
